Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) has attracted more and more attention for its advantages of high efficiency, low emission, and strong fuel adaptability.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: However, the fuel adaptability also brings issues for thermoelectric cooperative optimization of SOFC system because different fuel compositions can result in different thermal stresses and system performances.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: In this paper, the temperature distribution and electrical characteristics of a 1 kW external steam-reforming SOFC system at different power stages are studied based on the 200-hour experimental data obtained from the system fed by hydrogen and methane respectively.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: The thermoelectric characteristics of SOFC system using hydrogen and methane as fuels with the same output power are further compared.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: Furthermore, the influences of methane conversion rate (MCR) on the thermoelectric characteristics in SOFC system are analyzed through a mathematical SOFC system model and a Gaussian process regression (GPR) model is constructed to predict the MCR.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: The results show that, the stack voltage of the SOFC system fed by methane (CH4-SOFC) is lower than that of the SOFC system fed by hydrogen (H-2-SOFC) by 0.59-4.35 V for the hydrogen concentration at the anode is relatively low in the CH4-SOFC system.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: Meanwhile, the electrical efficiency of the CH4-SOFC system is lower than that of the H-2-SOFC system by 0.85-6.08% in the power range of 300-600 W.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: In terms of thermal characteristics, the stack temperature gradient on the fuel direction of the CH4-SOFC system is much larger than that of the H-2-SOFC system.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: Different methane conversion rates (MCRs) in the CH4-SOFC system can shift the stack temperature distribution significantly, and properly increasing the MCR can effectively increase the stack voltage and electrical efficiency.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: Finally, the GPR model can accurately predict the MCR and the MAPE is 0.030%, which can prevent the deformation and fracture of cells caused by the excessive temperature gradient in the stack when the MCR is too low.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction

Sentencas: This work lays a foundation for system control strategy design in the future, especially SOFC stack thermal management, improving the fuel adaptability of the system and ensuring the safety of the stack temperature.
Titulo: Thermoelectrical-based fuel adaptability analysis of solid oxide fuel cell system and fuel conversion rate prediction
